title: Statuette Base of Ia-Ib
description:
Oblong wooden base of a statuette.
James, Corpus, p. 42 "This piece was purchased by Wilbour in Qurna in Western Thebes, in 1888; it is mentioned in his notebook 2-I 18. the citation in PM, loc. cit., give as Ia-ib's title "royal hearld (?), but the sign in question seems certainly to be Hm not wHm. The title 'servant of the king is not common."
inscribed: "Offerings which the king gives to Ptah-Sokar. May he give invocation offerings, meat and fowl and linen to the Ka of the royal servant Ia-ib, true of voice"
credit_line: Gift of Evangeline Wilbour Blashfield, Theodora Wilbour, and Victor Wilbour honoring the wishes of their mother, Charlotte Beebe Wilbour, as a memorial to their father, Charles Edwin Wilbour

museum_location.name: This item is not on view
